bibl.title: Dionysiac Elements in Antiope and P. Oxy. 3317. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Revised version of a lecture given at the colloquium "La construcció de la imatge del déu en la tragèdia grega", organized at the University of Barcelona (Spain) on 19 September 2009. - 1. Dionysiac elements in the prologue of Antiope. - 2. Transitional elements: Zeus the satyr and the chains of slavery. - 3. Dirce Bacchans: Bacchic frenzy or despotic cruelty? - 4. Antiope's revenge and P. Oxy. XLVII, 3317 (= M.-P.3 433.1; LDAB 940). - 5. P. Oxy. XLVII, 3317 and Antiope. - 6. A postponed cognition. - 7. Conclusion.
bibl.seg: López Cruces Juan Luis, Dionysiac Elements in Antiope and P. Oxy. 3317. Avec résumé en anglais.

Revised version of a lecture given at the colloquium "La construcció de la imatge del déu en la tragèdia grega", organized at the University of Barcelona (Spain) on 19 September 2009. - 1. Dionysiac elements in the prologue of Antiope. - 2. Transitional elements: Zeus the satyr and the chains of slavery. - 3. Dirce Bacchans: Bacchic frenzy or despotic cruelty? - 4. Antiope's revenge and P. Oxy. XLVII, 3317 (= M.-P.3 433.1; LDAB 940). - 5. P. Oxy. XLVII, 3317 and Antiope. - 6. A postponed cognition. - 7. Conclusion.
